tags.name: Offering
tags.description: The offering API facilitates seamless CRUD operations, allowing staff to create, retrieve, update, and delete offering items, and related entities with ease.

Bearer.description: Provide a valid bearer token in the Authorization header. Example: 'Authorization: Bearer {app_token}'

type.description: Type of the offering. Possible values include: **package**: For the main business subscription; **app**: For marketplace app subscriptions; *addon**: for additional products like SMS, staff_seat and module.

SKU.description: The unique code of the single SKU this offering represents. Offerings support exactly one SKU; to combine multiple SKUs, use a bundledOffering or similar higher-level abstraction.

quantity.description: The number of items included in the offering

payment_type.description: The payment type field defines the payment options available for an offering,**external**: Payment is not done by the platform (typically an API call from the partner), **free**: No payment is required; **single_charge**: A single, one-time payment is required to obtain the offering; **monthly**: A recurring payment made on a monthly basis; **annual**: A recurring payment made on a yearly basis; **bundle**: A subscription bundled with another subscriptio. If an offeing is defined as bundled it can not be sold as a separated subscription

is_active.description: Current status of the directory offering

vendor.description: The business entity or vendor that offers this SKU.

currency.description: The currency used for the price. Supported currencies: USD; EUR; GBP.

trial.description: Number of days for the trial period. If not specified or set to 0, it indicates no trial period is offered.

reporting_tags.description: A list of tags to be used for reporting purposes

currency.description: The currency used for the price

trial.description: Number of days for the trial period. If not specified or set to 0, it indicates no trial period is offered.

is_active.description: Current status of the directory offering

reporting_tags.description: A list of tags to be used for reporting purposes

directory_offerings.description: List of newly created DirectoryOfferings (for bulk creation)

bundldedOfferings.description: List of newly created BundldedOfferings (for bulk creation)

directory_uid.description: Unique identifier for a directory. Defines which directory is authorized to sell this Offering.

offering_uid.description: Unique identifier for an Offering. Defines an offering the directory is authorized to sell.
Unique identifier of the offering which the bundled item is being added to
The underlying directory offering uid. Must be a valid offering_uid either from vcita or from the offering GET API.

purchase_currency.description: The purchase currency at the moment of the subscription was created. Supported currencies: USD; EUR; GBP

price.description: Optional. The actual amount charged to the customer. When provided, this overrides the standard offering price. This parameter is restricted to directory/admin tokens only and requires payment_type to be 'external'. When price is provided, the system stores both original_price (from the offering) and price (the discounted amount).

discount_code_name.description: Optional. String identifier for the coupon/discount type (e.g., 'percent', 'fixed_amount'). Used for tracking and reporting purposes.

coupon_code.description: Optional. Discount identifier used for tracking and Recurly integration. This is the coupon code that will be applied to the subscription.

payment_type.description: The payment type field defines the payment options available for an offering. When price override is used, this must be set to 'external'. **external**: Payment is not done by the platform (typically an API call from the partner); **free**: No payment is required; **single_charge**: A single, one-time payment is required to obtain the offering; **monthly**: A recurring payment made on a monthly basis; **annual**: A recurring payment made on a yearly basis; **bundle**: A subscription bundled with another subscription

purchase_state.description: The requested purchase state of the subscription. If expired is selected, the expiration_date is ignored and current date will be used. If canceled is selected, the expiration_date must be provided. Note that is_active is dymanically calculated based on status and expiration_date

expiration_date.description: The date to expire the subscription. Should be in ISO8601 format (e.g., 2023-10-01T00:00:00Z) and at least one day in the future. Use 'expired' purchase_state if you want to immediately expire the subscription.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of the offering. Possible values include: **plan**: For the main business subscription; **app**: For marketplace app subscriptions; **addon**: for SMS, staff_seats and other SKUs.

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description: The underlying SKU, can be a code name of a package, a code name of an app or a code name of an addon like SMS or staff_seat. If not specified, all SKUs are returned

parameters.name: directory_uid
parameters.description: A specific directory mentioned by its unique identifier

parameters.name: payment_type
parameters.description: The payment type field defines the payment options available for an offering,**external**: Payment is not done by the platform (typically an API call from the partner), **free**: No payment is required; **single_charge**: A single, one-time payment is required to obtain the offering; **monthly**: A recurring payment made on a monthly basis; **annual**: A recurring payment made on a yearly basis; **bundle**: A subscription bundled with another subscription

parameters.name: is_active
parameters.description: The Offering status

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number of the results

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: How many items to return per page

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort by fields, e.g., "created_at:asc,updated_at:desc"
